item.title: Notes on Arya et al., 2000 TBC
item.description: The paper: Arya, A., J. Fellingham, Jonathan Glover , D. Schroeder, and Gilbert Strang. “Inferring Transactions from Financial Statements.” Contemporary Accounting Research vol. 17, (January 01, 2000): 366-385. Introductory Linear representations serve as useful tools for many fundamental accounting questions The Question Given a set of financial statement \(x\), what is the “best guess” of the underlying transaction vector \(y\)? The Solution Four steps to form the solution: Build a algebric representation for accounting process: \(Ay=x\) (\(A\) is the double entry matrix) Identify the fundamental subspaces of \(A\).
